content: She sustained a crush injury to her right middle finger by a dumbbell on 7-8-25 with immediate pain, swelling, and limited motion. She obtained urgent care x‑rays that demonstrated a fracture and was treated with a splint. Repeat x‑rays four weeks later showed a continued fracture, so she remained in the splint and presents today for evaluation. On exam she has a hematoma, excellent PIP flexion, DIP stiffness, no tenderness over the distal phalanx, and paresthesia at the distal phalanx. Imaging now shows a fracture of the distal phalanx with stable alignment and good healing.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Some hematoma noted excellent flexion of the PIP some DIP stiffness , no tenderness palpation of the distal phalanx , some paresthesia at the distal phalanx .
title: Musculoskeletal

content: A fracture of the distal phalanx with stable alignment and good fracture healing
title: Imaging Results
